intro: Rhododendron przewalskii subsp. huzhuense, commonly known as the Huzhu rhododendron, is a species native to the mountainous regions of China. It is characterized by its evergreen foliage and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of pink to red. The plant typically grows in acidic, well-drained soils and thrives in shady, humid environments. It is a member of the Ericaceae family, which includes many ornamental and ecologically important shrubs. This subspecies is valued for its ornamental appeal and plays a role in local biodiversity.
